main_definition: A common given name of Latin origin, which may also be used as an idiom in certain contexts representing various meanings or concepts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A variant form of the Roman family name Marcus (Latin meaning 'man' or 'warrior').
meanings_and_examples.example: Marcius was a prominent member of an ancient Roman family.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used to refer to someone named Marcus, often implying familiarity or endearment.
In some specialized contexts, 'Marcus' may be used metaphorically or symbolically to represent certain ideas or characteristics associated with the name.
meanings_and_examples.example: The leadership qualities of Marcus reminded her of his namesake from Roman history.
